message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of seasons on various natural phenomena. Seasons cause changes to prairies, as different seasons bring different weather conditions such as temperature and precipitation that impact the growth and development of plants in prairies. Option (A) is incorrect because volcanic eruptions are not directly influenced by seasons. Option (B) is incorrect because moon cycles are not affected by seasons. Option (D) is incorrect because planets orbit in a regular pattern around the sun and are not directly influenced by seasons.

Option (A) is incorrect because volcanic eruptions are not caused by seasons. Option (B) is incorrect because moon cycles are not influenced by seasons. Option (D) is incorrect because the orbit of planets is not directly influenced by seasons.
